t: Proverbs 8
Wisdom’s Appeal
Doesn’t*pn wisdom call out? Doesn’t*ln understanding make her voice heard?
At*ln the heights overlooking the road, at*ln the crossroads, she takes her stand.
Beside*ln the gates leading into the city, at*ln the main entrance, she cries out:
“People,*ln I call out to you; my*ln cry is to the children of Adam.
Learn*ln to be shrewd, you who are inexperienced; develop*ln common sense, you who are foolish.
Listen,*ln for I speak of noble things, and*ln what my lips say is right.
For*ln my mouth tells the truth, and*ln wickedness is detestable to my lips.
All*ln the words from my mouth are righteous; none*ln of them are deceptive or perverse.
All*ln of them are clear to the perceptive, and*ln right to those who discover knowledge.
Accept*ln my instruction instead of silver, and*ln knowledge rather than pure gold.
For*ln wisdom is better than jewels, and*ln nothing desirable can equal it.
I,*ln wisdom, share a home with shrewdness and*ln have knowledge and discretion.
To*ln fear the Lord*s is to hate evil. I*ln hate arrogant pride, evil conduct, and*ln perverse speech.
I*ln possess good advice and sound wisdom; I*ln have understanding and strength.
It*ln is by me that kings reign and*ln rulers enact just law;
by*ln me, princes lead, as*ln do nobles and all righteous judges.
I*ln love those who love me, and*ln those who search for me find me.
With*ln me are riches and honor, lasting*ln wealth and righteousness.
My*ln fruit is better than solid gold, and*ln my harvest than pure silver.
I*ln walk in the ways of righteousness, along*ln the paths of justice,
giving*ln wealth as an inheritance to those who love me, and*ln filling their treasuries.
“The*pn Lord*s acquired me at*ln the beginning of his creation, before*ln his works of long ago.
I*ln was formed before ancient times, from*ln the beginning, before the earth began.
I*ln was born when*ln there were no watery depths and*ln no springs filled with water.
Before*ln the mountains were established, prior*ln to the hills, I was given birth —
before*ln he made the land, the fields, or*ln the first soil on earth.
I*ln was there when he established the heavens, when*ln he laid out the horizon on the surface of the ocean,
when*ln he placed the skies above, when*ln the fountains of the ocean gushed out,
when*ln he set a limit for the sea so*ln that the waters would not violate his command, when*ln he laid out the foundations of the earth.
I*ln was a skilled craftsman beside him. I*ln was his delight every day, always*ln rejoicing before him.
I*ln was rejoicing in his inhabited world, delighting*ln in the children of Adam.
“And*pn now, sons, listen to me; those*ln who keep my ways are happy.
Listen*ln to instruction and be wise; don’t*ln ignore it.
Anyone*ln who listens to me is happy, watching*ln at my doors every day, waiting*ln by the posts of my doorway.
For*ln the one who finds me finds life and*ln obtains favor from the Lord,*s
but*ln the one who misses me harms himself; all*ln who hate me love death.”
